articles.title: Buffett’s $24 Billion Selling Spree: The 6 Stocks Berkshire Hathaway Dumped
articles.mainIdea: Buffett’s $24 Billion Selling Spree: The 6 Stocks Berkshire Hathaway Dumped
articles.summary: 24/7 Wall St.: Buffett’s $24 Billion Selling Spree: The 6 Stocks Berkshire Hathaway Dumped. Investors began to notice that Warren Buffett began being more conservative with the stock market three years ago, and that streak has continued even as the S&P 500 hit new peaks and beyond. He sold Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Bank of America (NYSE:BAC), VeriSign (NASDAQ:VRSN), DaVita (NYSE:DVA), D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI), and Nucor (NYSE:NUE) as of Q3 2025. ... articles.title: 2026 outlook: Big Banks are getting back their 'earnings mojo'
articles.mainIdea: 2026 outlook: Big Banks are getting back their 'earnings mojo'
articles.summary: Yahoo Finance Video: 2026 outlook: Big Banks are getting back their 'earnings mojo'. Major bank stocks are poised to close 2025 with serious gains; most notably, Citigroup shares (C) are already up 67% while Goldman Sachs (GS) has surged 57% (or nearly $330) year-to-date. Whalen Global Advisors founder and chairman Chris Whalen — alongside TPW Advisory founder Jay Pelosky — speaks with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman about his consensus on the banking sector heading into 2026, citing various corporate credit risks amid the Federal Reserve's current interest rate environment. Also catch Yahoo Finance Senior Banking Reporter David Hollerith and Hennion & Walsh CIO Kevin Mahn discuss the 2026 outlook for regional banks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts. Related tickers mentioned: C, GS, JPM, MS, MS-PQ, WFC, XLF.

articles.title: BofA CEO Moynihan on Economic Outlook, AI and Fed Rate Cuts
articles.mainIdea: BofA CEO Moynihan on Economic Outlook, AI and Fed Rate Cuts
articles.summary: Bloomberg: BofA CEO Moynihan on Economic Outlook, AI and Fed Rate Cuts. Bank of America Chair and CEO Brian Moynihan says the US consumer is in "pretty good shape" going into 2026. Speaking with David Westin on Bloomberg Television, Moynihan also says the Federal Reserve will have room to cut rates next year.
